name: Oven-Fried Orange Roughy
author: Pecos Bill
summary: This recipe is a light alternative to pan-fried fish. A combination of cornmeal, bread crumbs, and dill weed gives this recipe a savory flavor in less than 25 minutes.
ingredients: 1 pound orange roughy, cut into 1 1/2x2-inch pieces
directions: Preheat an oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C)
Move oven rack to position slightly above middle of oven
Mix cornmeal, bread crumbs, salt, paprika, dill, and black pepper together in a shallow bowl
Pour milk into a separate bowl
Dip orange roughy pieces into milk and then press into bread crumbs to coat on all sides
Gently toss between your hands so any bread crumbs that haven't stuck can fall away
Place breaded orange roughy into prepared baking dish in a single layer while breading the rest
Drizzle butter over the breaded fish pieces
Bake in preheated oven until fish flakes easily with fork, about 10 minutes
